intro: Trichera drymeja subsp. tergestina, commonly known as the Tergestine Trichera, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe, particularly the Italian region of Apulia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, calcareous soils and thrives in sunny, open habitats. It is known for its small, fragrant flowers and is often found in rocky or sandy areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and locally endemic species.
